pull.title: guix: use GCC 14.3.0 over 13.3.0
pull.body: Switching to using GCC 14.x for release builds has come up multiple times recently. It will eventually be needed for #25573, and could also be useful for #30210.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#33764](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33764) (ci: Add Windows + UCRT jobs for cross-compiling and native testing by hebasto)
* [#32764](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32764) (guix: Build for macOS using Clang only by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -93,7 +93,17 @@ chain for " target " development."))
       (home-page (package-home-page xgcc))
       (license (package-license xgcc)))))
 
-(define base-gcc gcc-13) ;; 13.3.0
+(define base-gcc
+  (package
+    (inherit gcc-14) ;; 14.2.0
+    (version "14.3.0")
comments.body:
Why 14.3.0 specifically, and not 14.2.0?

(asking because 14.2.x is mentioned in https://gist.github.com/hebasto/dee3c918da49ee767ccf5eea43276407).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -93,7 +93,17 @@ chain for " target " development."))
       (home-page (package-home-page xgcc))
       (license (package-license xgcc)))))
 
-(define base-gcc gcc-13) ;; 13.3.0
+(define base-gcc
+  (package
+    (inherit gcc-14) ;; 14.2.0
+    (version "14.3.0")
comments.body: I'd rather we use the version of the compiler with more bug fixes, and less known bugs.

comments.body:
> and the maybe-uninitialized below can be removed?

Fixed the URL, I don't think we can drop it yet: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/actions/runs/19074211079/job/54485090675?pr=33775#step:8:3723.
